text: Although located across from CSN, a potentially great location for a fast-food type restaurant, I can see why this restaurant is not busier.  While the food is made-to-order and it is good, it is a little pricey.  $1.88 per dumpling-- which are bite-sized-- is too much when you can get top-grade dim-sum for a lower price at any Chinese restaurant that serves the same.  We ordered Mongolian beef, and the beef itself was tender and flavorful, but there was hardly any beef at all in this dish-- it was overrun by onions and peppers. While I appreciated that Chiam offered organic and gluten-free specialties, I thought that the cost was too steep for the value.  Sadly, my companions and I decided that it was not worth a return visit.
Its really a good dim sum the best love all of it .Service is good nice people and love the decorations.
The staff was awesome! Clean and made to order fresh food!. I would come back just for the staff! The dim sum is awesome!

Amazing vegetable spring rolls, delicious tiger shrimp, great service! Highly recommend :)

All their shrimp products are very fresh, especially shrimp shu mai!
Really clean restaurant. Staff is so friendly and helpful. Food is made to order and fresh. I recommend the Florida orange chicken and trying some dim sum. Definitely coming back soon.

I tried the Chiam at the boulevard mall. It was the most disgusting disappointment dim sum place I have ever been . I ordered the dynasty Mongolian beef and pork bun. The beef was basically ground beef the only time beef should be ground in a asian dish is almost never come to think of it I can only think of one dish that is dry cooked string beans with ground pork (Thai dish) . the vegetables were barely present their was no flavor at all . it looked like chili on top of white rice.. Wendy's chili taste better than that dog food.. And the pork bun wasn't bad but for $3 the portion was sorry . And the pricing is waaay to much they charge for each piece of dim sum lol like come I'm not that picky when it comes to food . By far worst place I've ate in Vegas get some authentic dim sum at "Orchids Garden". This place has never failed me . To everyone that gave this place more than 1* has never had authentic dim sum .. I honestly would rather eat McDonald's.

Horrible service, no selection 2 hours before they close.  Especially if you want Dim Sum.  Inflexible if you want to substitute items.  But the Thai Bistro restaurant across the parking lot is great and the staff is friendly!

Pros: This place offers dim sum and doesn't use MSG. 

Cons: The prices are expensive, especially since it's an a la carte, order and seat yourself type of place. 

Probably won't go again, even though I'm allergic to MSG and love dim sum.

Wonderful place and really good food .
Coming back to this place for sure .
Place is really clean and the personnel is very friendly .
A keeper !
Love this place! Great ambience, friendly staff. The food is authentic and the portion is generous! I highly recommend everybody to come experience and you'll agree with me!!!!! :)

The food and prices seemed reasonable. The food tasted good and without an overly greasey feeling that I've  come to expect from places like this. The decor is very clean and pleasant with lots of red and pretty umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. Overral I  feel like it was a good meal and a friendly place.

How have I never been here? MY NEW GO-TO! A Chinese American (get it? chi-am?!) spot with organic & vegetarian options... AND no msg! Everything was so fresh & made to order; might have costed a tad more than typical dim sum places, but YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! Quality over quantity, clearly. After eating Asian foods -- my skin feels oily, my stomach is in on/off knots & I feel sluggish. Not at ALL after this place! And I definitely indulged out of excitement! 

FOR HER: I ordered the TIGER WALNUT SHRIMP, which had surprisingly large battered shrimp in a creamy mayo sauce topped with candied walnuts. Paired with WHITE RICE & LONG LIFE NOODLES. I also tried the JUMBO SHRIMP SIU MAI (fave!), JUMBO SHRIMP DUMPLING, and SHRIMP & PARSLEY DUMPLINGS. All served hot and fresh, so delicious... ordered 3 of each! 

FOR HIM: He ordered the BEEF & BROCCOLI with WHITE RICE. As a Chinese food fanatic, he was very impressed! Very flavorful, fresh steamed broccoli (I don't even like broccoli and I liked it!),  and extremely satisfying! He also was impressed with the dim sum as he could not get over how it was not coated in oil like we're used to at other places! 

They also have some very cool promotions going on while we were there. They had good priced catering options with free delivery, a Spring Value Box special (entree & side for only $4.88!) and the cutest Chinese dress accessory for wine bottles given with any $20.00 purchase! Oh, and check in on YELP & you get 20% off your next visit! 

Also have to add this is probably one of the cleanest places I've ever eaten at. Even the bathrooms! The decor is very cute & modern as well (especially the ceiling!)... and the customer service was amazing from start to finish. Devonne & Chung the cook were so nice! I feel like I can go on and on about this place honestly! My only qualm was that I got too full to try more of their dim sum selection -- which I will definitely be back to try! :)

WOW, THIS PLACE BOMB! All of their food is made fresh, full of flavor... AND has vegetarian & organic options! I enjoyed the dim sum but the beef and broccoli was my fave! Try the shrimp siu mai too! The prices might be more than usual dim sum places, but you get what you pay for... PURE QUALITY! Not oily and doesn't make you feel crappy after like other places usually do. I WILL DEF BE BACK SOON! :D
Free WiFi,  quiet,  inexpensive Chinese American grub.  Very affordable price. They advertise a side and entree for under $5.

A great little place when you're in the mood for dim sum and you don't want to drive all the way by china town and see the crazy traffic. I tried the fried rice and orange chicken with some shrimp dum sum on the side. It was really tasty. Orange chicken was nice and crunchy while the noodles wasn't salty and was really good. The dim sum was made fresh so it was super good! Going to try other items in the menu soon!
Love the place!!! So great to be able to get Dim Sum quick!!! Food is amazing and they have the super cool coke machine that has a million combos!

As we walked in, we were told they were out of pork and beef. Not a great start to our visit. Then we got the sticker shock- a plate with two entrees and a large side (similar to what you'd get at Panda Express) will run you $13 without a drink. Was the quality worth it? Debatable.

Pacific Garlic Prawns: they're shrimp not prawns, good flavors, but sauce was thin and watery 
Mandarin Chicken: BF said texture was rubbery, I found the sauce too sweet
Broccoli & Beef: Guess it was the last of their beef?, average
Teriyaki chicken: better than expected
Sides: fried rice and long life noodles were okay,  less greasy than similar spots. 
Dim sum: shrimp ball was bland, parsley-shrimp dumpling tasted good but the skin stuck to the serving dish and fell apart.
Drinks: They have smoothies for $7 with additional chia seed, protein, etc for +$1 add-on. Strawberry-peach flavor recommended by the cashier was refreshing. Fountain beverages use the Coke Freestyle machine.

Service was polite, but extremely slow. Despite the cafeteria-style setup, food is made to order, which is good but takes longer than expected for this type of restaurant. My noodles came out after my guy was completely done eating his meal.

TIPS: Join their mailing list for various offers. They currently offer 20% off coupons for your next visit if you check in on Yelp.

Found this place beside Denny's restaurant. Its a clean fast food restaurant. They have vegetarian menu if you're a vegan. The thing that i noticed about their place is that it is similar to Panda Express, the difference is they don't have their food out. Everything is cooked fresh when you order it. So you have to wait for 15mins which is why i gave them 4 stars since i don't like waiting. I ordered beef broccoli which was $4.88, that's the smallest box where i got a side and one entree. The food was good and tasty. The beef was soft. I looked up the reviews at yelp and saw that they have shui mai, and i remember my boyfriend wants those so i ordered some for to go which she said would take 10-12mins. The lady told me that she only have 2 shumai left which sucks. The lady was very helpful. I only saw 2 workers in the restaurant. The price is a little bit too much, but i guess its worth it for the taste of the food.

Will never come back here again. The reason why i gave 2 stars was for the cleanliness of the place. Food wasnt good. I came in and all the employees were sitting down in the dining room and on their phones or laptop. The thing that really annoyed me was that they ran out of almost everything. I came for dimsum and they only have shrimp shumai and steamed pork bun left. They dont have bottled water...they were out of the shrimp on their list of entrees. I tasted the shumai and steamed pork bun and it wasn't even good. I regret paying $14 for my meal. Yes its overpriced too.

Pros- staff is friendly and food comes out hot and fresh 
Cons- Panda Express is just as good (if not better) and cheaper.
The food was hella good. I like the Mongolian beef, I like pretty cashier, they asked me if I needed anything.I just needed their number lol.

Came here to just pick up some steamed rice and they seem to be pretty unpopular. All of their steamers are off so I'm assuming their food is cooked fresh. 

I had a couple in front of me and while they were ordering they were debating what they wanted and the cashier told them that one of the items they were thinking about was "nasty". My jaw basically hit the floor when she said that. I don't think she intended to say it that way but it came out sounding bad. I haven't tried their actual food but I'm not sure I want to try it knowing an employee thinks it's "nasty".

This is the first restaurant in Vegas I ever walked out of and demanded my money back!  This is a fast food type place. It was a Saturday around noon and the place was empty, we were the only customers. When my wife and I got our orders the portions were tiny, they put them in those little sectioned off plates,  and the rice side was huge, the entrees  were about 1.5'x 1.5' and about .25' deep. Not a lot of food for 12 bucks (for one order) I  am a vegetarian and I had a vegetable dish, the only vegetables in it were snap peas and tiny cut up pieces of green zucchini, Nothing else no carrots, broccoli, water chestnuts, yellow zucchini and some gross liquids all over it. I think it must have been boiled and not steamed. The tofu dish tasted disgusting and looked that way too. they did provide a lot of rice which was the only decent thing on the plate. Oh for being a healthy place? no low sodium soy sauce-not too healthy!  My wife isnt a vegitarian and orderd a shrimp dish, and a chicken dish. She didn't know she ordered fake shrimp (which they charged me an additional charge for as it was real shrimp). It was disgusting- she threw it out. That's when she wanted our money back, they gave me 11 bucks back and a receipt showing they gave me 27 bucks back (the cost of both meals) I just wanted out of there! lunch was ruined. I will NEVER, NEVER NEVER BE BACK OR RECOMMEND THIS PLACE, Look if you want fast food Chinese there are other competitors that are much better (although with this place its not a high bar) and give you more value for your money.

Get the GROUPON!  Total deal!!  $24 for $40.  Nice clean place. You might think this is another fast Chinese food restaurant but it's all made fresh when you order!  I chose 2 items and a side for around $9.  They have some healthier and or vegetarian options!  The chicken and beef was tasty and tender not chewey or fatty.   Oh and great fried rice and loved the extra fat noodles!

so there we go ...try and eat out instead of pick up....
we thought it was ok...commercially acceptable....
we don't like people much...so maybe I should not say ...then   the food could speak for itself...
commercially acceptable....
other places next.....
Food looked like it would be good but very bland and the fried rice was mushy... We were the only ones in the restaurant.  Thank goodness I had a groupon!

Dim Sum = Dim Out
So excited when driving down Charleston and I see a restaurant advertising Dim Sum. So excited after passing it I made a U-turn to check it out. Appearing nice and clean, I entered during the lunch hour and only two other people were there. 
I walked up to the counter to place my order. I first asked for Chicken Shu Mai, I was told they were out. Then I asked about the Steamed Buns. I was told they were out of anything that had chicken. So I asked for the Steamed BBQ Pork Buns. The cashier went around to the kitchen, came back and said they were out of those too. Finally I said, what do you have? and proceeded to order. I had the Pork Soup Dumplings, Shrimp Shu Mai and Fried Shrimp Ball. By the way, they have no vegetable dim sum. I was told it would take about 15 minutes. That's time to get the frozen product out, thaw, steam and or fry. The food was ok.  I most likely could have gotten the same items at Costco and cooked it myself at home. Behind the counter, there are empty steamers. I'm guessing when they first opened they cooked a lot of food that unfortunately went unsold, so now they cook to order. I may try again, just to see how there entrees taste. They appeared to be freshly prepared and I did see some vegetables in one order.

From 3/5/16
Whelp, I hate to leave a bad review, but this situation left me with no choice. The food here is left out too long, to the point of becoming inedible. I ordered the walnut shrimp, but the girl mistakenly gave me garlic shrimp. When I sat down and noticed I had the wrong shrimp. I thought give it back, as I glanced down I noticed the sauce was gelatinous, I almost ralphed upon looking at it. I was like "This isn't the right shrimp, need to say something!" I go up get the walnut shrimp and it was the same issue; it was slimy seafood. 

Needless to say, we did not finish are food, only ate a few of the noodles. I hope this place wises up and starts putting out fresh food because there is nothing more disappointing than getting bad food.

Not good at all....walking in, the place had a super weird vibe, but we were already there and decided to give it a try.  There was one person there (besides the 2 employees working), and he didn't appear to even be "dining", just on his computer the entire time.  So we walk in, and there's many little covered tin dishes with labels, as if insinuating that those items were hiding under the lids waiting to be served up. When we ask to see the items, the gal behind the counter tells us that the items don't even exist.  So..... weird exhibit A.  Moving onto Weird exhibit B, we look above at the wall mounted menu and tell the girl what we would like to order.  And everything is made to order.  So..... it's a dim sum place, but made to order. Oooook. Fine.  Considering the depths of our hangover and hunger levels, the rice was on point, being compared to roadkill that is.  A solid 2 out of 10 stars.  Ok, that's being nice. But it wasn't awful... the mixed vegetables were no better than Panda Express, actually they weren't even that good.  And the teriyaki chicken sucked!  Again, considering the hangover and hunger, we ate it.  Even the "hot mustard" packets that Chinese food lovers adore had zero burn.  No nasal burn like we all love.  Don't wast your time....

This place has a really good selection for food and their wait staff is extremely friendly - the only down side was their soda machine was practically out of everything to drink. The food was tasty and since it is cooked to order was fresh and hot.
Great Dim Sum, queen steamed rice! Good portion and super tasty food. Really a little nougat to eat a snack or meal. Great friendly service too. I highly recommend.

Service was fantastic, greeted me right when I walked in, was a nice touch.  Very clean, food was spectacular!  Wow!  And I'm from NJ so you know I take my Chinese food seriously!  Couldn't believe the price!  Very reasonable for made to order.  No MSG too.  They have the coke machine so have every selection imaginable!!!!  I strongly recommend!

Decent food, ok taste, but quantity is not the best. I believe they could have given more food on my plate. A little pricey for the amount. Of food received. I am satisfied because I purchased a groupon for $12 for $20 worth. They were out of a lot of foods as well, which are the most popular foods at 3pm on a Saturday. Staff was very nice and it was very clean. Ok for a lunch spot.

My favorite Chinese food in town. Its always made hot and fresh and it tastes different...like...less salty than other Chinese food. I never feel blothed after eating it and its satisfying food. I love the Florida (Orange) Chicken and Teriyaki with noodles. Their noodles are the best! Icing on cake...the have Dim Sum...but only sometimes...and its variety is based off what that have which changes daily. When its available though...its delicious.

We had dinner last night. It's a clean and nicely decorated fast food restaurant. They have vegetarian menu if you're a vegan and list of organic entrees. Everything is cooked fresh when you order it. We waited about  15 mins or so.

We ordered several dim sum such as Pork sui mai, Shrimp dumplings, Shrimp Sui Mai,  Pork Soup Dumplings and for entree, Tiger Walnut shrimp which was my favorite and I love the crispy Vegetable spring rolls. Also we tried Jumbo Pacific shrimp ball. 

The food were better than I thought it would be. 
A lot of stuff were out that night. I asked for Veggie Tofu soup but there were out and the girl that worked there said they could make Egg drop soup with corn. That was not on the menu but nonetheless the soup was very tasty.  I would come back for some quick dim sum fix.

I had previously reviewed ChiAm's first location at Jones and Craig shortly after opening.  I saw the Charleston location, and decided to give it a try.  The business is hard to see from the street, but right across from the Community College.  It was noon, but the business had few customers.  Nonetheless, based upon the excellent experience at the other store, I ordered the $8.88 combo.  Noodles, rice or vegetables plus 2 protein entrees.  I had the mandarin chicken and the beef with broccoli...then waited 10-15 minutes.   Everything was made to order, but worth the wait.   Piping hot, large quantities of very tasty food rivaling the best Chinese restaurants in Las Vegas.  Quality ingredients make it really stand out against Panda (my opinion).  I posted a photo of my order with this review.

I was really disappointed. They no longer carry the vegetarian pepper steak or any vegan dim sum. I ordered the walnut shrimp ($13.88), Mongolian beef ($11.88), and vegan shrimp ($11.88) total ($40+) and received three little cardboard cartons. Period. Definitely not the portions I received at the Jones/Craig location that closed, and definitely not worth what I paid. Lesson learned.
Dimsum at its finest at ChiAm Restaurant.  Siumais are tasty and not soggy. Buns and dumplings also are fresh and flavorful. Food are also served in huge portions. Place is decent and casual looking.

Great selection of fresh Chinese dishes to choose from! My soon to be daughter in law & I decided to check this new place out for lunch. Affordable and fresh delicious Chinese food and a fortune cookie  too! Love the decor with pretty red parasols hanging from the ceiling!

ChiAm is located in a little corner across from the College of Southern Nevada, and claims to specialize in Dim Sum. The exterior is simple and appealing, especially to those who appreciate good Chinese dumplings. 

I felt immensely welcome waking in, save for the usual awkwardness of coming into a (personally) new restaurant. The overall layout mimics a basic Panda Express, and the food itself looked somewhat old. This could be due to their lack of consistent clientele, considering that they are fairly new. I'd like to say that the food would have probably been fresh had we come at a busy hour. The food itself was both delicious and disappointing. The sweet and sour shrimp dish was my main concern. I should have sampled it beforehand; the texture was a bit off. 

However, their tofu and chicken dishes were excellent. Specifically the tofu. It made up for the inconsistencies of the shrimp. The Dim Sum was tasty, but again, probably sat out for a little longer than comfortable. The textures were great, flavor was there, and appearance was on point. 

The young lady at the front was patient with us and absolutely wonderful. A very great personality who jumped at the chance to assist us. Overall, the service was excellent. 

I'm positive that with more customers, this place would be a five star eatery. We intend to come again, with even higher expectations.
My food was made to order and was very fresh and tasty. The order-taker was super friendly and the vibe wasn't bad.

Great, fresh food. The place is clean and has a friendly staff. I was the only person when I went it, so the service was really fast. I see a lot of of people complain about the pricing, but they reduced the prices from what I saw. You can get a two item combo with your choice of white rice, fried rice, or noodles. Everything is made to order, so everything you get is fresh. Its in a shopping center right by CSN on Charleston, so it was weird that no one else was in there.
Freshly made food, reasonable prices, perfect portions. Super clean. Best orange chicken.

Five stars on service alone. They were so sweet and accommodating. But we're not all here for just service right ... This place also offers Chinese food. Good selection of dim sum! Didn't have my fav beef balls but that's ok lol I love that they use organic ingredients and have veggie options. 20% discount if you work nearby! They're a new place so show some love!

I have been here a few times.  Now the bad part is this particular unit. And shopping center, has the worst luck staying in business.  Every place that faces the street has good luck in this shopping center but this particular unit was both a Smash Burger and a Mexican restaurant (I can't remember the name).  So they were set for struggles from the get go.  

This restaurant's biggest problem is identity.  They continuously try to identify what they are.    The menu board stays the same but how they represent the items change.  Sometimes it's a lot of food, or a little.  Prices are fluctuating   The lunches were big when they were 10-13  and became small when they developed a spring lunch special (that is still going on).

The food quality has ranged from freshly cooked and delicious sauces to rip off of Panda.  I still like it for that quick bite since I work across the street, but it's hard to predict what my food will look like and that is straying my business away over the past couple of months.

The identity crisis only increases when I see other locations in town that don't seem to struggle.  My suggestions, change the dim sum menu and face it towards the front entrance and find ways to make that be part of the special for the day.  If you get more focus on items 5 dollars or less, you will appeal more to the neighborhood we are in.  From there, advertise to CSN with food samples and flyers.

Stopped in for a late lunch (around 2:30 pm) a couple weeks ago. The steam tables were all shut down. They fixed my Mongolian beef fresh, but that didn't help--it was oily, had no spice, and was a really small portion.  The fried rice was a huge pile, and it was salty mush.

Friendly staff, but wow.... that food was the worse I've ever had. I couldn't even finish my first bite of my favorite siu mai, made me nauseous.

Again nice staff, just food was horrible. This explains why they are empty.

Ok, I don't get it. ChiAm? Haven't we already turned Chinese food into American food? This felt like the same thing in a different wrapper. It reminded me of Mexican places that sell Tacos and Enchiladas served on a fancy plate and charge $11.99 for 3 tacos. Had the mandarin chicken with rice and tried some other dish my gf ordered. It was fine, tasted like Panda Express to me. They were out of shrimp. It took forever to get my food and it cost $13. Strange d√©cor that's neither American nor Chinese. Like there's nothing I liked about this place. The end.

The dumplings were very tasty...but a bit expensive for one--they are sold individually.  It would have been a little better had they come two in an order for that price.  My family ordered 12 & it was over $20.  The cashier was friendly & restaurant was clean.  Perhaps we will have to try the other entrees.
This place NEVER has their full dim sum menu. Before the w craig location was the same. Service always friendly,  food always good and price is ok.

Got a Groupon $12 for $20 worth of food. Good thing I got the Groupon because the food is pricey for what it is. The food was not that flavorful and some of the quantities were small. Might as well go to Panda and pay $6. They also didn't have some of the foods we wanted to order. However, the restaurant was nice and clean. I loved the ceiling deco.

Well, I think this place has potential but it's not there.  The food was good but way to heavily sauced.   The Mongolian beef tasted great but again over-sauced.  Same with the chicken.   I think the food needs a bit of a fix.   Everything is done fresh.   Location is a bit hidden.  I think if you improved food, lowered cost, and moved to better location it may be a to-go place.   For now, not on my list.

I have to give this place 3 stars for right now.  We have been seeing commercials on TV about this place having Organic selections and natural items.  The commercials also advertise they are having their grand opening, so we decided to go support them as we LOVE organic and really wanted to try this place.

The day we went, Meagan was very helpful along with Karla the Manager.  Unfortunately last week was NOT their Grand Opening, it was a soft opening which means, they did not have anything organic or natural available as of yet.  Also, they only accepted cash, they could not accept credit or debit.

Everything was explained about the menu and the Dim Sum has a much larger selection then the other store.

So, wait about another week as they were not sure exactly when the Grand Opening would be or when they would have everything up and running and ready to go.  I am sure once this place gets up and running to full capacity it will be a 5 star place.  

As for now, the location was pretty easy to find, right across from the CSN Campus, it was clean, they will run out of seat once fully open at certain times throughout the day but that means they are having some great success. 

Give this place a try and give them support as there are NOT a lot of places in town that serve this style of food and go out of their way to use Organic and Natural ingredients.

Pretty nice place. It's very clean. Friendly without being in-your-face friendly. The food tasted good. Not crazy awesome but better than I thought. Tasted better than biting into a handful of grease or nothing at all, as I tend to describe most Asian cuisine places like that. I enjoyed it and it wasn't too expensive. Was like $24 for two platters of two entries and rice with two free drinks. Might eat here again.

Introduction:
We were definitely reluctant in trying ChiAm out based on the reviews.  I must say that my friend and I were super glad we decided to try it out.  From the reviews, it appears to us that the owners must have made some adjustments since. For example, everything is now made to order. Which is awesome, pro-everything was so fresh.  Cons-you do have to wait, but totally worth it.

Quality: 5/5
We had the King Fried Riceu, Mongolian Beef and Florida Orange Chicken combo, probably one of the tastiest fried rice and Orange Chicken I've had in awhile. The Mongolian Beef was good too, but I've had better.

In addition, we had the Chicken Sui Mai, Chicken Dumpling, BBQ Pork Bun and Red Bean Bun. I must say, I was surprised how good they were as well. I love the fact that you can order any of those options without shrimps, usually, I have to remove my shrimps from other Dim Sum places and by the time I am done, I get exhausted.

Quantity & Price: 5/5
The portions were generous for the price.  $8.88 for three items is amazing. Two Dim Sum items from a portion of the Menu for $2.88 & three Dim Sum items from another Menu for $4.88 is definitely a killer deal.  

The one thing I must caution you on is that you need ro read the Menu's carefully. For example, if it reads two for $2.88, Mix and Match, that means if you want two of something, you have to let the cashier know. I was a dork, I completely missed that "Mix and Match" verbiage. But that was my bad, thank goodness I had enough to eat because of their combo portion generosity.

Cleanliness: 5/5
The place was super clean, including the restroom. The utensils, quality napkin and self serve drink areas were kept up and maintain immaculately.

Customer Service: 5/5
Claudia was amazing, super accommodating and very patience with us.  Because it's our first time, she answers all our questions with ease and did not appeared annoyed by us. Thank you Claudia! We appreciate that :)

Tips:
Check in on Yelp to get a 20% off. In addition, right now, you can get $20 for $12 from Groupon, that's what prompt us to try ChiAm out in the first place. It works, cause we're definitely going to be back.  I hope this place will be sticking around cause we really like it.

We should have gone next door to DickBlick, bought crayons and ate them. Worst Chinese fast food ever.  Glad I did it as a Groupon. I would needed astroglide if I paid full price. I bet this place tanks soon.  The pork dim sum tastes gamely and smells like a stockyard. The shrimp was watery. They cook to order so that is one on the first signs of trouble. Just don't do it! Think of the children and whales and gorillas in the mist. This is drunk food to throw on booze after a binder

Groupon ftw! Came here to redeem a Groupon on $20 worth of food and wasn't disappointed with the portions and quality. Also loved the organic options which meant the hubby who isn't a Chinese food fan and eats organic enjoyed his meal.

The place looks nice and modern inside. We were excited to eat dim sum... unfortunately getting there an hour before closing wasn't enough because they stopped serving 2 hours before closing! Very upsetting. Did I forget to mention the young lady who was waiting to serve us was unaccommodating and the menu gave us no options. Literally had 6 options of meals. Don't even bother asking for a substitution for veggies instead of the rice or noodles. Save your time and money for the real dim sum restaurants!!

Everything at this restaurant is made to order and excellent. It is casual, clean and friendly. We had Dim Sum and it was delicious as was the Long Life Noodles. I highly recommend this little gem of a restaurant. Don't forget to try the Chocolate Espresso

They were out of half of the things on the menu.  They let us know ahead of time of the things they were out of and then 5 minutes after I ordered they said they were out of that too. They didn't have water bottles and when i asked for a water cup and went to the beverage station they didn't even have water. The food was very good though so still 3 stars.

I'm giving them 2 stars because of the soda fountain and the finalized customer service, not the start of the customer service tho.  They close at 8pm from what I overheard, and I arrived at 705pm to see everything clean and shiny, so I got excited about great food potential.  First time there, and couldn't quite figure out the menu and prices, but I saw what I wanted up there and was told, "we're out of" to the two items I really wanted.  So, then I ordered and was willing to pay extra for the shrimp options, only to be told; "just so you know, when you order shrimp there is only 3 pieces"...so...scratch the shrimp option!  

Basically, for $11+ this dinner was a disappointment for something I could have gotten at PandaExpress and known exactly what I was getting.  She did try to redeem herself, between chat messages on her cellphone, by stating "we make everything fresh to order here" as she saw me start to ask a question.  That's great, happy to know it's going to be fresh!  And that I can say was true, the food was fresh!  I'm also going to add the food was not saturated in sugary or salt - and had decent flavor - but it begged something more - not sure what that "more" would be, but it was missing that "ohhhh yeah, I'll be back" factor.  

Then, call me picky, but I've never EVER been to any kind of Asian based food establishment that doesn't give a fortune cookie.  I was truly disappointed with that.  Kinda happy to see the cashier put down her phone long enough to check up on my food, and bring it to me personally rather than leave it on the counter.  Figured it was because I was the last customer of the day, or close to it.  I'll probably be back, because I really REALLY want to try their walnut shrimp or tiger shrimp but I can guarantee I won't go at the end of their business day again.

This place was pretty good.  I like that the food was made fresh for us and tasted great.  The wait seemed a little long just because there were only two people working.  However those two that were there were very helpful and rushing around trying to get everyone their orders as fast as possible.
I like ChiAm better than Panda Express because the menu is much more varied and extensive, primarily because of the dim sum and made to order items.
I like this restaurant because they have the friendly staff and good dim sum. I will come back for sure.

First impressions are always the greatest it took me forever to get someone from the back to the front of the restaurant to create an order. They do not even let you see the food by lifting up the cover only in pictures but it is available on the front line which I thought was interesting. Also by the time I want it to make my order they said they ran out of noodle and the lady said she didn't know when they were going to make any more.

This place did not leave me dying to come back
The food is fresh and pushes cooked to order vegetarian choices. Clean kind and friendly courteous service I think I'll come back specials as low as 4.88.

No Stars Here!!! 

Drove a long way to have Dim Sum and got there 1 1/2 before they closed at 8, but they stop serving all but 6 items on the menu at 6pm. They wouldn't even do any substitutions. 
So I saw a Thai place in the same parking lot, Thai Bistro! Really nice place and great service!! 

Don't bother coming to this Chinese Restaurant it's a waste n bad attitude n service!!!

There's never anyone in this place (it's next to Walmart where I buy my groceries) but I thought I would give it a try anyways. I have only come one other time to get some quick dim sum but only left with two shrimp dumpling because everything else I would have had to wait 15 min for. This time I got the side + two entree special. I also wanted to see if I could pick up some dim sum as well but again, there would be a 15 min wait (I get it, there's not enough foot traffic in this place for them to have the dim sum sitting out) but still, disappointing. So I opted not to wait. One of my entrees was the honey walnut shrimp, so understandably there was an added cost. I was very disappointed with the shrimp; not only did I receive only 3-4 of them, but the mayo cream sauce was OLD. It was pretty disgusting, I could barely eat it, it smelled so bad. Overall, too pricey for the quality of food that is given. Would not come again.

This is like a healthier, fresher version of Panda Express, except they actually cook the food fresh for you!! Super friendly service, however menu is often limited with not much dim sum to really choose from.  Since they are a made to order type restaurant, it's not really all that fast. But overall, the quality isn't bad :) 

I had shrimp and fried rice, and the shrimp (big prawns) were fresh and cooked well. The order came with 3 pieces. The rice on the other hand was just mediocre, about on par with Panda Express....

Would recommend if you're in the area, but would not drive out of the way to come here.

This place is really delicious the food is so unique and it's friendly to everyone. I highly recommend this to anyone that wants to try Chinese style food. It's super convenient, right in the corner to be noticed.

Tried it for the first time today. It was really good-fresh very clean. It's very modern looking sleek inside. Everything is cooked on the spot (takes about 15mins after you order). Just remember Dim-Sum is Small portions-combo fried rice was good. They did not have chicken-for any of the meals .
The drink machine had some issues but the pink lemonade was good.
